intro: Costus kaempferoides, commonly known as the false arrowroot, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Zingiberaceae family, which includes ginger and turmeric. The plant is characterized by its tall, slender stems and large, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange and are clustered in inflorescences at the top of the stems. Costus kaempferoides is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has also been used in traditional medicine.
